name: Energy Crystals
statement: There are three energy crystals numbered $$$1$$$, $$$2$$$, and $$$3$$$; let's denote the energy level of the $$$i$$$-th crystal as $$$a_i$$$. Initially, all of them are discharged, meaning their energy levels are equal to $$$0$$$. Each crystal needs to be charged to level $$$x$$$ (exactly $$$x$$$, not greater) . In one action, you can increase the energy level of any one crystal by any positive amount; however, the energy crystals are synchronized with each other, so an action can only be performed if the following condition is met afterward: for each pair of crystals $$$i$$$, $$$j$$$, it must hold that $$$a_{i} \ge \lfloor\frac{a_{j}}{2}\rfloor$$$. What is the minimum number of actions required to charge all the crystals?
inputFormat: Each test consists of several test cases. The first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 10^{4}$$$) — the number of test cases. The description of the test cases follows. The only line of each test case contains a single integer $$$x$$$ ($$$1 \le x \le 10^{9}$$$).
outputFormat: For each test case, output a single integer — the minimum number of actions required to charge all energy crystals to level $$$x$$$.
